titles.title: NACIE Improvement Act
NACIE Improvement Act
National Advisory Council on Indian Education Improvement Act
NACIE Improvement Act
National Advisory Council on Indian Education Improvement Act

A bill to ensure that the National Advisory Council on Indian Education includes at least 1 member who is the president of a Tribal College or University and to require the Secretaries of Education and Interior to consider the National Advisory Council on Indian Education's reports in the preparation of budget materials.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.
Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
National Advisory Council on Indian Education Improvement Act or the NACIE Improvement Act
This bill revises the membership and duties of the National Advisory Council on Indian Education.
Specifically, the bill requires the President to ensure that the council includes at least one member who is the president of a tribal college or university.
Additionally, the bill requires the council to submit its annual report to the Department of Education (ED) and the Department of the Interior.
ED and Interior must consider the council's report when preparing their budget materials.
